customer_name: REFLECTION RIDING ARBORETUM AND NATURE CENTE

citations.narrative:
The enclosure housing the male sandhill crane does not currently have a shelter structure that provides shelter from wind
and precipitation. Construction of a shelter structure has been started and was actively observed during the inspection.
Projected time to completion is by the end of the week. The enclosure does provide shade via topography, an adjacent
structure and trees. Adequate shelter is necessary to protect birds from adverse weather conditions and prevent their
discomfort. Outdoor housing facilities must provide adequate shelter appropriate to the species and physical condition of
the birds for the local climatic conditions. Correct by 4/3/24.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
